result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Oliver

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas Oliver appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Nicholas Oliver.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on leave. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas Oliver appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Nicholas Oliver.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Status Of Counsel. Defense Counsel confirms appointment to the case. Requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Oliver not in court, in custody in MSDF.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant unable to be produced by video from MSDF. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nicholas Oliver appeared by video, in custody at MSDF.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Nicholas Oliver.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. AS TO COUNT 4:  Defense raised awareness to the incorrect "habitual criminality repeater" enhancer (939.62(1)(c).  State moves to amend to correct enhancer 939.62(1)(b). Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
